data.title: 94 Companies Hiring Software Engineers
data.meta_description: Companies hiring software engineers look for knowledge of coding languages, tools and best practices for building and maintaining digital products.
data.text:
Render is a software firm that offers a cloud platform for software developers and engineering teams. The platform allows developers to host their products on the cloud through a simple and streamlined process that permits software to be deployed extremely quickly. It’s highly scalable and prioritizes uptime and reliability so that developers can rely on its cloud infrastructure with minimal complexity. Render hires software engineers across disciplines including product and security.

Fintech company Flourish offers tools for financial advisors, equipping them with technology solutions they can use to help clients reach their financial goals. Flourish’s software engineers need to be able to support a scalable platform and collaborate with other teams throughout the organization.

Achieve makes products for consumers who have outstanding credit card bills and other sources of debt. By offering solutions like debt consolidation, low fixed-rate personal and home equity loans and financial education, it aims to help customers gain financial independence and sovereignty. Achieve GOOD is a mobile application that allows users to create debt payoff plans. This and other software products are built by Achieve software engineers.

Comcast Advertising specializes in technology solutions designed to cover the entire TV advertising ecosystem. Its three brands — Effectv, FreeWheel and AudienceXpress — deliver products that are meant to streamline media buying and selling and development of effective ad campaigns. Software engineers for Comcast Advertising must be comfortable working collaboratively and have lots of experience with programming languages like C++, Python, Scala and Golang.

Bilt Rewards makes fintech tools that serve the growing portion of the population who rent their homes. Bilt’s offerings include fee-free credit cards that consumers can use to make rental payments, which earns them points in a rewards ecosystem. Most landlords and management companies do not accept rental payments on credit cards, but Bilt partners with a network of rental providers to make this possible, and even offers points-earning options for out-of-network rent payments. Bilt is hiring for multiple software engineering roles out of NYC.

The Aerospace Corporation performs research and data analysis in the aerospace and defense sector. Its research team collects data and information to generate technical recommendations for space exploration and defense companies, who rely on its accuracy, information security and efficiency to bring them the mission-critical information they need to guide engineering and manufacturing decisions. The company is always hiring exceptionally talented software engineers.

Attain operates an opt-in purchase platform that is used by marketers to assess strategies for outcomes like gaining new customers and retaining existing ones. It runs a portfolio of apps, including the B2C financial services apps Klover and Frisbee, that customers use for shopping rewards and financial tools in exchange for sharing their consumer data. This data is then analyzed by Attain in a marketing research capacity.

Fintech company Current’s digital tools are meant to simplify banking and credit building for consumers. The company has openings for both early-career and more senior software engineers who can expect benefits like hybrid work options, a flexible vacation policy and access to resources to support their mental and physical health.

Asana builds software solutions for work management. Organizations from industries like retail, media, food and travel use Asana’s AI-powered technology to efficiently manage allocation of time and other resources, as well as incorporate automations into their workflows. Asana is hiring software engineers to work in locations like New York, San Francisco and Vancouver.

Valon is a real estate fintech company that uses technology to expand the way residential mortgages are serviced. It offers data and analytics-driven management to lenders and homeowners on a platform where users can make payments, find loans and seek refinancing while accessing mortgage information and financial advice. Valon is hiring software engineers to work remotely from its NYC base.

Remitly’s online and mobile platform facilitates money transfers across more than 170 countries and territories. Founded in 2011, the fintech company now has upwards of 2,400 employees supporting its mission to expand access to financial services. Remitly seeks software engineers to fill roles in the United States, Poland, Canada and other locations throughout its global operations.

Aerospace and defense contractor Shield AI makes technology that joins leading-edge AI with mechanically engineered products, like AI-powered drones and fighter pilots that are operated autonomously by AI pilots. The company is recruiting software engineers to work on ongoing development projects into existing and novel applications for autonomous AI.

MacPaw is a software development company building tools for Mac and iPhone users. Its offerings keep devices free from clutter and protect them from malware in addition to letting users locate duplicate files, encrypt files, unpack archives and navigate the internet using a VPN. MacPaw is hiring software engineers to support new and existing digital products.

Global visual content creator and marketplace Getty Images provides powerful images on its platforms gettyimages.com, unsplash.com and istockphoto.com. The company captures, creates and preserves visual content from early photography to 8K video. The company is hiring software engineers across several departments, including enterprise search, royalties and technology services.

Motive uses IoT hardware and AI-powered applications to create productivity and security in automation of driver safety, vehicle tracking, maintenance, compliance and more. It serves industries that include logistics, food production and construction.

GHX provides supply chain solutions for the healthcare industry. The company’s software-as-a-service solution works to help hospitals reduce business costs. GHX’s cloud-based platform can improve visibility into the medical-surgical supplies clinicians use in patient care, allowing hospitals to provide effective patient care while driving out costs.

Chime says it’s on a mission to empower everyday people to have a simple credit building process without unnecessary fees so that they can take control of their finances. It has mobile banking services that help customers receive their paychecks up to two days early and build their credit. The company allows users to withdraw cash without fees from over 600,000 ATMs and doesn’t charge for overdraft under $200.

Grainger provides B2B clients and work sites with products for operations, repair and industrial MRO. It offers products that include safety vests, testing instruments and hard hats. The company uses machine learning and AI throughout its product development. It hires for its hybrid workplaces.

Chamberlain Group builds technology to secure homes, businesses and community spaces and provide easy access for authorized individuals. The company needs software engineers who are capable of taking care of responsibilities like producing technical documentation and troubleshooting software development issues.

Personio serves small and medium-sized businesses as a holistic HR software that streamlines the people management process throughout the lifecycle of recruiting to offboarding. The company says it aims to offer organizations the ability to get past the spreadsheet era through its all-in-one solution to help businesses manage their workforce and scale.

Having operated for more than a century, Liberty Mutual is an insurance provider offering a range of products and services to individuals and businesses. The company’s offerings include personal and commercial coverage for automobiles and property, as well as specialty lines, reinsurance, workers’ compensation and more.

Leveraging expertise in safety science, UL Solutions aims to equip companies with the capabilities to build a safer, more secure and more sustainable business model. UL Solutions is hiring for software engineering positions across its global operations, seeking experts in programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, C# and SQL.

Bubble’s visual programming platform allows users to build and host full-featured web apps without needing to know or use code. In addition to building, launching and editing the app, designers can find support with a list of consultants and agencies that offer extra help. Bubble is currently hiring for a senior software engineer on the platform team, a staff engineer on the editor team and a staff engineer on the ecosystem team.

Businesses use the Celonis platform to analyze their internal processes and identify opportunities to streamline their operations. Its technology solutions also allow organizations to monitor the long-term progress of improvement initiatives. The company has 3,000 employees spread across its global operations and is hiring for software engineers in locations like Madrid, Munich, New York and Raleigh.

Dynatrace makes security and observability tools that help clients improve the ways they use software products, from reducing IT incidents to improving cybersecurity. Its products work by collecting data from clients’ use of various software programs and then analyzing that data to provide process insights. Dynatrace is hiring across back-end, front-end, DevOps, full-stack, product architecture, product owner, security engineering and system engineering roles.

AffiniPay enables businesses in the legal, accounting, architectural, engineering, construction, psychology and accounting industries to access ​​practice management software and online payment tools. The company’s solutions serve over 245,000 professionals with tools for increasing productivity, receiving payments faster and more.

Notion offers a digital workspace that enables planning and collaboration across business teams and allows organizations to save money by consolidating tools. It includes an assistant powered by artificial intelligence that can answer questions, help with writing and editing and provide actionable insights based on documents, meeting notes and other sources. The company has a variety of openings on its engineering team for software experts who can provide support in areas like product infrastructure and security.

8th Light is a design firm that creates digital products and assets like software architectures and mobile apps. Its focus is on building beautiful, design-forward and aesthetically pleasing digital entities for B2B clients. The 8th Light onboarding process for new team members includes a rigorous training period designed to provide high-level professional development and mentorship. It currently seeks new software developers to bring on in this capacity.

Greenlight Guru builds software products for medtech companies. Greenlight Guru Quality offers features to support the entire product lifecycle, while Greenlight Guru Clinical covers data collection and management for clinical trials. The remote-first company looks for software engineers who are skilled problem solvers and have experience with cloud-native software.

Datadog offers companies a cloud monitoring service to protect against cybersecurity threats and supervise clients’ full IT architecture. Its solutions also include infrastructure monitoring and serverless computing. The company has partnered with household names like Samsung, Sony and Uber.

Nourish is a healthtech company focused on providing patients with affordable, virtual access to nutrition counseling. Patients can connect with a registered dietitian and arrange for an initial assessment to develop a care plan that supports their personal goals. Nourish needs experienced engineers to collaborate on projects with its product and design teams.

Software firm Superhuman makes an AI-powered email client that promises to streamline and manage a client’s email inbox, using advanced features, shortcuts and interfaces. It is notable for including novel tools and features like an option to track where a recipient is located when they read an email and relies on top-tier software engineers to develop these elements.

January’s digital debt recovery platform is built to enable creditors to take a more empathetic approach to engaging borrowers to improve collection rates. It also includes tools to enhance compliance, security and risk monitoring to protect clients. The company boasts an engineering team culture that prioritizes trust, providing transparent and actionable feedback while celebrating wins.

Rula operates a telehealth platform for mental healthcare. The company provides individual, couples, family and child therapy as well as psychiatry from a network of trusted and qualified providers. The platform works with clients to pursue insurance coverage and to provide coverage and pricing transparency. Its SVP of Engineering is growing the Rula engineering team through targeted hires in software.

Financial services company Capital One offers credit cards, checking and savings accounts, auto financing and business banking solutions. Its engineering team includes data engineers, site reliability engineers, back-end engineers and DevOps engineers who work on a variety of digital solutions to serve Capital One clients.

DraftKings is a sports tech company offering web and mobile platforms for sports betting on live and fantasy sports as well as online casino games. DraftKings engineers have the opportunity to contribute to the company’s technological innovations while working with the latest tech. Its engineers have the chance to work cross-functionally and touch multiple parts of the business.

PNC offers banking services for individuals, small businesses, and corporate and institutional clients ranging from checking and savings accounts to small business loans. The company says its technology employees are able to continue growing and developing new skill sets. Software engineers at PNC apply their expertise in various programming languages and frameworks to solve business challenges and collaborate on building digital tools that serve internal teams and customers.

FusionAuth makes identity and access management software, which software developers integrate into apps and websites to ensure information security and privacy. The FusionAuth platform allows users to log into digital assets through a customized authentication process so that materials remain secure without unnecessary friction. FusionAuth hires software engineers with a wide range of specializations.

Biotech company GRAIL employs both technology and clinical experts to collaborate on solutions for early detection of various cancers so that patients can access potentially life-saving treatment sooner. GRAIL is hiring engineers for its expanding software teams to work on systems for processing patient samples and projects that support the company’s data infrastructure.

Hiro Systems makes software development tools that code builders use to construct decentralized apps with Bitcoin and Stacks. Hiro tools allow developers to build and activate their apps using blockchain with smart contracts and digital assets, in keeping with the company’s founding principles of open-source transparency and public benefit. The company seeks software engineers who specialize in blockchain.

Navan equips companies with travel and expense management solutions. Its tech solution enables employees to book business trips and earn rewards that can be applied to personal travel. Its software lets finance teams issue corporate cards, reimburse employees for out-of-pocket expenses and view real-time insights on how employees are spending.

Bectran offers SaaS solutions companies use to streamline operations across their credit, collections and accounts receivable departments. Bectran’s software engineering team members contribute to building and improving digital tools designed to meet user needs for businesses of all sizes.

AWeber is an email marketing firm that focuses on automation in marketing processes. It primarily serves small business clients and offers tools to support marketing campaigns, like an AI writing assistant that can generate and edit copy, templates for email marketing that establish best practices for design and length, and email list process guides that walk clients through contact acquisitions. AWeber seeks several software engineers like back-end specialists and technical back-end leads.

Klaviyo is a marketing tech company offering AI-powered solutions that enable brands to build more efficient workflows and personalize customer engagement across email, SMS and mobile push formats. Software engineering is an important component of Klaviyo’s operations, and the company has multiple openings for engineers who can leverage their expertise to help deliver quality digital services to customers.

Square makes software and hardware products that businesses use to handle a range of important operational responsibilities from accepting payments and managing online orders to establishing customer loyalty programs. The company offers learning and development resources and a diverse array of employee resource groups to foster a supportive work culture for teams like engineering.

Rocket Travel offers a portfolio of tech products and services to help travel brands around the world grow and connect with customers. The company says its culture is meant to empower employees across the organization to “take action, own decisions and rise together as one team.” It’s looking for software engineers to contribute to building, deploying and optimizing digital solutions that enhance the customer experience.

Strong Analytics makes custom machine learning software products for the consumer goods, tech, pharma, hospitality and gaming industries. Its ML tech features reinforcement learning, ML pipelines and deep learning vision, which are various methods of ML by which machines are trained to function intelligently. The company is headquartered in Chicago.

Sonar offers open-source and commercial products that developers use to ensure they’re producing “clean code.” Clean code is driven by the principles of simplicity and transparency and is meant to be easy for developers to read, comprehend and maintain. The company is hiring engineers in several departments, including product management, IT operations, solutions engineering and language analysis.

Adyen provides a single solution for online, in-app and in-person payments, as well as revenue optimization and fraud prevention. Its platform offers end-to-end payment solutions, financial products and data-driven insights. The fintech company has teams across more than two dozen offices in locations that include Shanghai, Toronto, Mexico City and Chicago.

Two Barrels is actively growing its engineering team to support its new products currently in development. The PSaaP, or professional services as a product, company currently employs over 650 people across the United States and boasts a 95 percent employee retention rate.

EliseAI is a machine learning company that makes conversational AI tech that serves as support staff in client-facing industries like property management and healthcare. “Elise” is a natural language processing AI that can comprehend and mimic spoken language, including colloquialisms like slang, typos and simultaneous questions. EliseAI is recruiting a number of software engineers.

Kikoff is growing its engineering team, with a particular focus on mid-senior engineers. The fintech company provides a personal finance platform that offers simple credit-building solutions. Designed to help users achieve financial wellness, the startup was founded in 2019.

NBCUniversal’s family of media brands includes globally-recognized names such as DreamWorks, Bravo, E!, Telemundo, Universal Studios Hollywood and Rotten Tomatoes. It has job opportunities in a variety of areas including engineering. NBCUniversal hires software engineers who are proficient in programming languages like Python and C# and are able to work closely with other teams to produce strategic digital solutions.

BAE Systems, Inc. offers tech products that include scientific instruments, spacecraft products and stealth antennas. It aims to help organizations protect national security, people, vital information and critical infrastructure. The company reinforces its products with data-based insights.

In Machina Labs smart factories, robots are programmed with automated functions and tasks specific to building formed sheet metal components. With minimum human interaction, the robots and smart factories churn out product components for clients in aerospace, defense, automotive and consumer goods. The company is hiring software engineers to work on-site in Los Angeles.

GitLab offers an AI-powered DevSecOps platform that developers and programmers can use to deliver software efficiently and securely. It aims to deliver innovative solutions monthly so that developer teams can ship code quickly. The company’s solutions include GitLab Duo, which uses AI throughout software’s development lifecycles.

McCain Foods’ french fries and other prepared food products feed people in approximately 160 different countries. Technology careers at McCain give talented engineers the chance to contribute to the company’s digital transformation and apply cutting-edge tech solutions to support business goals.

Jellyfish offers a platform that helps businesses and product teams optimize their software engineering operations. The company needs software engineers who are strong communicators and programmers and are able to build solutions that take into account the needs of both customers and internal teams.

McDonald’s is known for fast casual food, franchised around the world. In both front of house and back-end operations, the company leans heavily on tech to optimize and scale, and thus has a high need for software engineers. Second-level software engineers, or SEIIs, partner with product managers and product architecture teams to build digital technologies across initiatives. Many of these roles are remote.

Vorto is a B2B supply chain automation company that uses AI to predict demand for specific products. It syncs procurement and logistics processes to these predictions through automated triggers and initiation protocols. Its engineering team is composed of software engineers and data scientists who work collaboratively. The team is currently recruiting additional software engineers to further mitigate supply chain inefficiencies.

Endpoint’s digital solutions are meant to simplify the home-buying process. The Endpoint App, for example, brings together features like real-time notifications, e-signing and earnest money deposits to streamline title, settlement and closing processes. The company offers internal mobility, opportunities to learn from expert colleagues and remote work options to support its software engineers and other employees.

Cash App’s platform lets users send and receive money, access banking services and buy stocks and bitcoin. The company also offers Cash App Pay and the Cash App Card for making purchases and accessing discounts. Cash App says its engineering professionals “balance agility with performance, iterating rapidly while maintaining stability and security.”

Block is the global company behind a range of well-known brands in the fintech space, including Square, Cash App and TIDAL. Block is looking to fill software engineering positions across specializations like machine learning and Android development. It has postings for roles in the United States, as well as Australia and Canada.

Click Therapeutics offers “digital therapeutics,” which provide prescription medical treatments that can be accessed on the patient’s smartphone. It can be used to treat various medical conditions in oncology, psychiatry, neurology and more. The company aims to treat conditions like nicotine addiction, depression and chronic lower back pain.

Forward Financing is a financial services provider that specializes in fast digital loans that serve as influxes of capital to small businesses. The company prioritizes financial access in its process, serving clients who often are unable to access the immediate operational cash they need through more traditional financial services providers like banks. Forward Financing is hiring software engineers to build and maintain its digital assets.

Dropbox offers cloud-based products for storing, sharing and collaborating on files, as well as automating processes for collecting electronic signatures for key business documents. Dropbox is looking for software engineers to fill roles across its global operations. The company published its Engineering Career Framework online as a way to be transparent both internally and externally about career expectations and progression for its software experts.

Gusto specializes in HR tech, giving businesses software solutions to handle critical processes like payroll, hiring and onboarding, benefits administration and collecting employee feedback. Engineers at Gusto work to build and optimize products that serve industries ranging from real estate and healthcare to manufacturing and construction.

Utility is a mobile app development company that designs, engineers and packages digital products from end-to-end on behalf of clients. Its small NYC-based team, which is composed of product experts, designers, engineers and product managers, works on platforms, digital experiences and apps. Utility has designed products for AirBnB, Forbes, BuzzFeed and the NBA. It’s on the lookout for engineers who specialize in iOS, Android and back-end work.

PatientPoint makes healthtech software for digital patient engagement, including platforms and communication tools like educational experience screens, interactive anatomical models and staff info hubs. On the PatientPoint platform, healthcare providers can send home informative readings with patients, communicate with support staff and provide remote patient monitoring. PatientPoint engineers to work on back-end systems and APIs, design microservices and build event streaming use cases.

Donnelley Financial Solutions, also known as DFIN, makes financial risk and compliance products. Built by data scientists, regulatory specialists and other financial services experts, the company designs, builds and operates software for SEC reporting, ESG reporting, partnerships, IPOs and corporate repositories. DFIN is seeking new software engineers to join its team.

Pinwheel facilitates direct deposit and provides payroll connectivity through tools, developer resources and APIs. It aims to help financial institutions gain and maintain customers with flawless customer experiences. The platform helps banks, lending apps and financial institutions provide better services to their customers with its real-time employment and income data. The company has processed over 10 million transactions since being founded in 2018.

Reverb runs an online marketplace for buying and selling musical instruments, offering tools to facilitate secure, simplified payments and shipping. The company seeks experienced, collaborative software engineers to deliver software to support its global operations and optimize the customer experience.

Atticus is made up of technology experts and legal professionals dedicated to providing services for people who need aid through disability, veterans and workers’ compensation benefits. The company has a remote workforce with openings for software engineers who emphasize performance and reliability throughout the development process.

ServiceNow has an array of cloud-based software products that equip businesses with AI capabilities designed to enhance productivity for teams such as HR, IT and customer service. The company says its engineering team focuses on “people-centric innovation,” with its software engineers collaborating on projects aimed at expanding ServiceNow’s portfolio of products and solutions to meet customers’ needs.

Agero serves businesses throughout the automotive and insurance industries, providing services and software products that enable roadside assistance, accident management, electric vehicle support and post-warranty benefits programs. The company needs experienced software engineers who can work with large-scale web applications to provide continuous support for both internal and client-facing systems.

Scythe Robotics makes the M.52, an autonomous electric mowing machine. This robot lawn mower is designed for commercial applications like corporate groundskeeping and professional landscaping, featuring 360-degree sensors and AI obstacle detection for safety. The company has several open positions on its software team, including cloud infrastructure roles, which will be dedicated to working on the autonomous development and perception systems of the M.52.

MORSE Corp builds and tests technology solutions to address U.S. national security challenges, with an emphasis on user-centered design and development practices. The company aims to foster a collaborative, interdisciplinary team that includes software engineers. MORSE Corp has open jobs for professionals with expertise in Python and algorithm development.

HoneyBook makes software for small businesses and freelancers, who use it to handle invoicing, project management, proposals, contracts and other administrative elements of running a business. Because all these processes are cohered in a single dashboard, it allows for ease of use and eliminates redundancy across software products. HoneyBook is hiring senior software engineers for frontend and full stack roles, which are hybrid out of Tel Aviv.

Scorability is a recruiting software company that makes digital tools for collegiate athletics. Athletes and colleges can use the Scorability platform to browse and match with each other, bringing much-needed transparency to a quasi-professional industry that has traditionally been excluded from many of the recruiting advancements in professional sports. The company was founded by D1 athletics parents who saw the need for disruption in collegiate athletics processes. Scorability recruits software development engineers to work on-site from its Austin office.

Arrow Electronics makes electronic components for computing, serving as a supply chain partner to thousands of industrial electronics manufacturers in the aerospace and defense, energy storage, green infrastructure, medicine and healthcare, renewable energy and transportation sectors. It’s hiring software engineers for roles out of Phoenix, San Diego and other sites across the U.S.

Kustomer makes software products that use AI to automate and improve customer relationship management. Its customer service bot, KIQ Customer Assist, represents client companies in sectors including retail and e-commerce, financial services, travel and hospitality. Mid-career and senior software engineers are sought by the company for roles that will collaborate with project managers, designers and technical writers.

Place Exchange is an advertising agency that handles out-of-home, or OOH, ad content, which includes every kind of ad a consumer encounters in physical spaces outside their house. From billboards to benches, leaflets to taxi ads, Place Exchange offers a programmatic, data-driven marketplace for the rich landscape of potential daily interaction with ad content. Serving both buyers and sellers, the company partners with premium advertisers and location owners to provide high-ROI options that reach consumers.

Provi’s platform connects alcohol distributors with their necessary retailers. The company has created a unified marketplace through its partnership with alcohol supply chain company Seven Fifty. It creates relationships between retailers like liquor stores or bars with distributors like Jack Daniel’s or Smirnoff that make ordering wholesale feel like online shopping.

FloQast is a software firm that makes digital tools for corporate accounting. Its products manage and automate accounting procedures and function as integrations within ecosystems like NetSuite and Slack. FloQast is expanding its roster of software engineers and has numerous open positions, which are all remote roles that can be performed from anywhere in the world.

Procare Solutions is a software company that makes a product for childcare management. It’s used by daycare centers, afterschool programs and youth organizations to organize their internal processes, communicate with parents and perform other essential functions of a childcare facility, like billing and payment processing. The company seeks software engineers and data engineers to join its team.

Arity makes insurance technology products for data and analytics in the transportation sector. Its tools analyze driver data at massive scale, scanning trillions of miles of data in search of insights that can be used to improve safety. Arity tools can be applied to contexts like usage-based automotive insurance programs, which charge drivers for their auto insurance policies based on mileage and how carefully they drive. AI powers all this analysis and data processing, which aims to improve safety, lower costs and reduce pricing bias.

Acrisure Innovation is the branch of insurance brokerage Acrisure focused on developing new technology solutions. It has “a small team of extremely high caliber engineers with a diverse background across industries and technologies.” Acrisure Innovation’s openings for software engineers seek applicants who can code in languages like Kotlin and Python and work with frameworks such as Dataflow, Spring and React.

Cockroach Labs designs tech products for software engineers in industries like fintech, media streaming and logistics. Its distributed SQL database provides a way for companies to house and use programming data, enabling them to scale and leverage several clouds at a time.

Chewy runs an online marketplace for pet products. Consumers can make one-time purchases for items ranging from cat litter to flea and tick treatments or set up recurring orders through Chewy’s autoship option. Chewy has multiple positions open for experienced software engineers who are proficient at writing and debugging code and can provide guidance for more junior team members.

Formation Bio is a pharmaceutical company using AI and other advanced technologies to drive drug development. Headquartered in New York, Formation Bio has multiple openings on its engineering team and offers hybrid job flexibility that lets employees split their time between working in office and remotely from locations of their choosing.

PagerDuty’s IT incident response platform is built to provide clear, low-touch automated incident response protocols for in-house IT departments. When IT systems face issues like hacking or code errors that result in downtime, PagerDuty’s protocols are triggered, prompting efficient resolution and workarounds as the issues are addressed. PagerDuty is recruiting software engineers to further build its code.

Financial services company SoFi offers products like private student loans, checking and savings accounts and a small business loans marketplace. It seeks software engineers to build and optimize technology for teams with a range of focuses, from home loans to member access and safety.
